Declare your independence from traffic and tolls this July 4th holiday by taking Metro-North to celebrate our nation's birthday. There are plenty of early getaway trains on Friday, June 30. On Monday, July 3, Metro-North will operate a regular weekday schedule. On Tuesday, July 4, we will operate a Sunday schedule (with one additional outbound New Haven Line train) to get you to and from the annual Macy's Fireworks. See full details at http://ow.ly/LP9D30cVH6c Have a happy and safe July 4th Holiday! View: http://n.v12.net/m?6B6AD

Effective July 10: NEW LIRR Summer Schedule & Travel Alternatives

Amtrak emergency repair work at Penn Station will cause summer service disruptions for some LIRR customers from July 10 through September 1. We regret to disrupt the train service our customers rely on to get to work and back home to their families and hope our alternative travel options and resources help keep you moving this summer. We are offering a special fare reduction of up to 25% off the normal ticket price for customers who avoid Penn Station and travel to alternate key transfer points, including Atlantic Terminal, Hunterspoint and Long Island City. Free weekday morning subway transfers at Atlantic Terminal, Hunters Point Avenue and Jamaica are also available for ticket holders. Visit MTA.info/lirr or call 718-217-LIRR to learn more about these offers and other summer travel alternatives and resources, including: Extra rush hour trains; New branch time tables; Free bus and ferry service to Manhattan; MTA eAlerts and text messages at www.mymtaalerts.com; LIRR's Train Time app and TripPlanner+ Planning ahead will help ensure you can get to and from your destination smoothly, and we are here to help you navigate the transition. MTA LIRR customer service representatives are standing by to answer questions in real-time, and we welcome your feedback on how we can deliver the service you need during this temporary period of disruption. You can reach us at 718-217-LIRR or MTA.info/lirr.

Effective July 10: NEW LIRR Summer Schedule & Travel Alternatives

Amtrak emergency repair work at Penn Station will cause summer service disruptions for some LIRR customers from July 10 through September 1. We regret to disrupt the train service our customers rely on to get to work and back home to their families and hope our alternative travel options and resources help keep you moving this summer. We are offering a special fare reduction of up to 25% off the normal ticket price for customers who avoid Penn Station and travel to alternate key transfer points, including Atlantic Terminal, Hunterspoint and Long Island City. Free weekday morning subway transfers at Atlantic Terminal, Hunters Point Avenue and Jamaica are also available for ticket holders. Visit MTA.info/lirr or call 718-217-LIRR to learn more about these offers and other summer travel alternatives and resources, including: - Extra rush hour trains - New branch time tables - Free bus and ferry service to Manhattan - MTA eAlerts and text messages at www.mymtaalerts.com - LIRR's Train Time app - TripPlanner+ Planning ahead will help ensure you can get to and from your destination smoothly, and we are here to help you navigate the transition. MTA LIRR customer service representatives are standing by to answer questions in real-time, and we welcome your feedback on how we can deliver the service you need during this temporary period of disruption. You can reach us at 718-217-LIRR or MTA.info/lirr. We appreciate your patience and understanding. View online: http://www.mymtaalerts.com/m?6B0FD

Effective July 10: NEW LIRR Summer Schedule & Travel Alternatives

Amtrak emergency repair work at Penn Station will cause summer service disruptions for some LIRR customers from July 10 through September 1. We regret to disrupt the train service our customers rely on to get to work and back home to their families and hope our alternative travel options and resources help keep you moving this summer. We are offering a special fare reduction of up to 25% off the normal ticket price for customers who avoid Penn Station and travel to alternate key transfer points, including Atlantic Terminal, Hunterspoint and Long Island City. Free weekday morning subway transfers at Atlantic Terminal, Hunters Point Avenue and Jamaica are also available for ticket holders. Visit MTA.info/lirr or call 718-217-LIRR to learn more about these offers and other summer travel alternatives and resources, including: - Extra rush hour trains - New branch time tables - Free bus and ferry service to Manhattan - MTA eAlerts and text messages at www.mymtaalerts.com - LIRR's Train Time app - TripPlanner+ Planning ahead will help ensure you can get to and from your destination smoothly, and we are here to help you navigate the transition. MTA LIRR customer service representatives are standing by to answer questions in real-time, and we welcome your feedback on how we can deliver the service you need during this temporary period of disruption. You can reach us at 718-217-LIRR or MTA.info/lirr. We appreciate your patience and understanding. View online: http://www.mymtaalerts.com/m?6B0FD Opt-Out: http://www.mymtaalerts.com/unsubscribefrommessage.aspx?e=dstecke@lirr.org

Effective July 10: NEW LIRR Summer Schedule & Travel Alternatives

Amtrak emergency repair work at Penn Station will cause summer service disruptions for some LIRR customers from July 10 through September 1. We regret to disrupt the train service our customers rely on to get to work and back home to their families and hope our alternative travel options and resources help keep you moving this summer. We are offering a special fare reduction of up to 25% off the normal ticket price for customers who avoid Penn Station and travel to alternate key transfer points, including Atlantic Terminal, Hunterspoint and Long Island City. Free weekday morning subway transfers at Atlantic Terminal, Hunters Point Avenue and Jamaica are also available for ticket holders. Visit MTA.info/lirr or call 718-217-LIRR to learn more about these offers and other summer travel alternatives and resources, including: - Extra rush hour trains - New branch time tables - Free bus and ferry service to Manhattan - MTA eAlerts and text messages at www.mymtaalerts.com - LIRR's Train Time?? app - TripPlanner+ Planning ahead will help ensure you can get to and from your destination smoothly, and we are here to help you navigate the transition. MTA LIRR customer service representatives are standing by to answer questions in real-time, and we welcome your feedback on how we can deliver the service you need during this temporary period of disruption. You can reach us at 718-217-LIRR or MTA.info/lirr. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

The Q35 will detour non-stop via the Cross Bay Veterans Memorial Bridge. Q35 service will be suspended at all Q35 bus stops on Flatbush Av between Troy Av/Quentin Rd and Floyd Bennett Field. The B41 provides alternate bus service along Flatbush Av between Avenue H and Kings Plaza/Avenue U. The Q35 will serve the regular bus stops on Avenue H at Flatbush Av, on Flatbush Av at Kings Hwy, and all bus stops in the Rockaways.

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

Bridgeplates to be used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms beginning Monday, June 12

Starting Monday, June 12, customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. The bridgeplates will be in effect for approximately 3 months, through September, while work is performed on Track 4. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

Bridgeplates to be used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms beginning Monday, June 12

Starting Monday, June 12, customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. The bridgeplates will be in effect for approximately 3 months, through September, while work is performed on Track 4. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

UPDATED: QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

Bridgeplates to be used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms beginning Monday, June 12

Starting Monday, June 12, customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. The bridgeplates will be in effect for approximately 3 months, through September, while work is performed on Track 4. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

Bridgeplates to be used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms beginning Monday, June 12, for approx. 3 months

Starting Monday, June 12, customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. The bridgeplates will be in effect for approximately 3 months, through September, while work is performed on Track 4. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

Bridgeplates to be used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms beginning Monday, June 12, for approx. 3 months

Starting Monday, June 12, customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. The bridgeplates will be in effect for approximately 3 months, through September, while work is performed on Track 4. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Select Trains Fri. June 9, and all day Sat. & Sun. June 10-11

Waterbury Branch substitute busing will take place on select trains Friday, June 9, and all day Saturday and Sunday June 10- 11. Bus service will begin on Friday starting with the 6:53 PM departure from Grand Central Terminal, and end with the 10:02 PM leaving Grand Central Terminal on Sunday. See yellow highlighted schedule for bus times at the following link, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Waterbury6.9.pdf Please note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we perform this track work on the Waterbury Branch.

Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Select Trains Fri. June 9, and all day Sat. & Sun. June 10-11

Waterbury Branch substitute busing will take place on select trains Friday, June 9, and all day Saturday and Sunday June 10- 11. Bus service will begin on Friday starting with the 6:53 PM departure from Grand Central Terminal, and end with the 10:02 PM leaving Grand Central Terminal on Sunday. See yellow highlighted schedule for bus times at the following link, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Waterbury6.9.pdf Please note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we perform this track work on the Waterbury Branch.

Z Line - Weekday Planned Service Changes

All times until Summer 2017 Manhattan-bound Z trains skip 121 St and 104 St, due to station rehabilitation. To these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Manhattan-bound J to 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd and transfer to a Jamaica Center-bound J. From these stations, use the nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd stations instead. Or, take the Q56 bus and transfer to/from J service at nearby 111 St or Woodhaven Blvd. Note: Jamaica Center-bound J trains skip 104 St and 121 St from 5:30 PM to 6:30 PM, weekdays; take a Q56 bus or the Z instead.
W Line - Weekday Planned Service Change

10:15 AM to 3 PM, Tue to Fri, Jun 13 - 16 W trains run every 20 minutes; no W trains running between 57 St-7 Av and Ditmars Blvd, due to station enhancements. Take the N instead. W service operates between Whitehall St and 57 St-7 Av, and via the Q to/from 96 St. Transfer between N and W trains at Times Sq-42 St. Note: Coney Island-bound N trains skip 30 Av, Broadway, 36 Av, and 39 Av during this time.
S Line - Weekday and Weeknight Planned Service Changes

DAYS 6:30 AM to 9:30 AM, Mon to Fri, Jun 12 - 16 3:30 PM to 8 PM, Mon to Fri, Jun 12 - 16 Expect platform and train crowding during rush hours, due to sidewalk reconstruction. Use the 7 between Grand Central-42 St and Times Sq-42 St. Customers at Times Sq-42 St who usually take the shuttle to the 4/5/6 can take the N/R/W instead to 14 St-Union Sq or Lexington Av-59 St. NIGHTS 12:01 AM to 6 AM, Tuesday, Jun 13 42 Street S Shuttle operates overnight, due to signal maintenance.
R Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

All times until Fall 2017 R trains skip Prospect Av, 53 St, and Bay Ridge Av in both directions, due to station enhancements. To/from Prospect Av, use the nearby 4 Av-9 St F/G/R or 25 St R stations via B37 and B63 local buses. To/from 53 St, use the nearby 45 St R or 59 St N/R stations via B37 and B63 local buses. To/from Bay Ridge Av, use the nearby 59 St N/R or 77 St R stations via B9, B37, and B63 local buses. Note: During late night hours only, D/N trains stop at 4 Av-9 St and 25 St, and N trains stop at 45 St (12:01 AM to 6:30 AM, every day).
Q Line - Weeknight Planned Service Change

Due to an earlier incident at 125 St, 4 and 6 train service has resumed with delays.
Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Select Trains Fri. June 9, and all day Sat. & Sun. June 10-11

Waterbury Branch substitute busing will take place on select trains Friday, June 9, and all day Saturday and Sunday June 10- 11. Bus service will begin on Friday starting with the 6:53 PM departure from Grand Central Terminal, and end with the 10:02 PM leaving Grand Central Terminal on Sunday. See yellow highlighted schedule for bus times at the following link, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Waterbury6.9.pdf Please note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we perform this track work on the Waterbury Branch.

Due to switch problems at 14 St-Union Sq, southbound 6 trains are running express from 14 St-Union Sq to Brooklyn Bridge-City Hall. Expect delays on southbound 4 train service. Allow additional travel time.
Bridgeplates to be used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms beginning Monday, June 12, for approx. 3 months

Starting Monday, June 12, customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. The bridgeplates will be in effect for approximately 3 months, through September, while work is performed on Track 4. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

Bridgeplates to be used on Inbound Scarborough and Philipse Manor Platforms beginning Monday, June 12, for approx. 3 months

Starting Monday, June 12, customers using inbound service at the Scarborough and Philipse Manor stations will need to use bridgeplates to get to their trains. The bridgeplates will be in effect for approximately 3 months, through September, while work is performed on Track 4. Customers are asked not to stand or walk on bridgeplates until after the train has stopped at the station. Thank you for your patience while we perform signal construction work along the Hudson Line, as part of Metro-North's Superstorm Sandy restoration. For more information, see http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Hudson_Bplates_6_12.pdf

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

UPDATED: QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Select Trains Fri. June 9, and all day Sat. & Sun. June 10-11

Waterbury Branch substitute busing will take place on select trains Friday, June 9, and all day Saturday and Sunday June 10- 11. Bus service will begin on Friday starting with the 6:53 PM departure from Grand Central Terminal, and end with the 10:02 PM leaving Grand Central Terminal on Sunday. Waterbury Branch Substitute Busing, Select Trains Fri. June 9, and all day Sat. & Sun. June 10-11

Waterbury Branch substitute busing will take place on select trains Friday, June 9, and all day Saturday and Sunday June 10- 11. Bus service will begin on Friday starting with the 6:53 PM departure from Grand Central Terminal, and end with the 10:02 PM leaving Grand Central Terminal on Sunday. See yellow highlighted schedule for bus times at the following link, http://web.mta.info/mnr/pdf/Waterbury6.9.pdf Please note: Buses will operate 15-30 minutes earlier than scheduled trains. Please listen for announcements and check Local or Express bus service to your destination while boarding. Thank you for your patience while we perform this track work on the Waterbury Branch.

UPDATED: QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS

QMT: MANHATTAN EXIT PLAZA CLOSURE OF "DOWNTOWN" LANES FOR THREE MONTHS For approximately three months, the two right "Downtown" exit lanes at the Manhattan plaza of the Queens Midtown Tunnel will be closed for the final stage of exit plaza roadway rehabilitation. Customers traveling Downtown can use the four open and newly resurfaced "Uptown" or "Crosstown" exit lanes, or the left "Downtown" exit lane, which will remain open during this period. In addition, East 37th Street between Tunnel Exit and 2nd Avenue has been temporarily converted to receive two-way traffic, to accommodate motorists exiting the tunnel from the Uptown lanes and seeking a Downtown route via 2nd Avenue.

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

Great Neck Elevator A - Out Of Service
Great Neck Station elevator A, serving the westbound platform, is temporarily out of service for preventive maintenance. A repair crew is on scene. We apologize for the inconvenience.

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8

New Schedule Effective June 4 Accommodates Mid-Harlem Line Track Improvements. New timetables effective June 4 will accommodate our comprehensive track improvement program on the Harlem Line between Mount Vernon West and Crestwood for eighteen weeks, from June 4 through October 7. One of the three tracks in this 4-mile area will be out of service at all times, reducing our operating flexibility and creating the potential for delays in the event of a service disruption in the area. To accommodate this work, the schedules of a small number of Harlem Line AM peak, PM peak, and Off-Peak trains will be temporarily adjusted, mostly between one and six minutes. No trains will be canceled or combined as part of this schedule change. Minor adjustments will be made to the Hudson Line schedule. No changes will be made on the New Haven Line. Please see a new timetable for details or visit http://ow.ly/9PA230bNOk8
